thread.title: Google backs Swedish VR gaming start-up
thread.title_full: Google backs Swedish VR gaming start-up | Business Spectator

author: Jens Hansegard
title: Google backs Swedish VR gaming start-up
text:
Resolution Games has raised $6 million from Google Inc.’s Google Ventures and other investors to develop virtual-reality games.
The cash inflow values the small game studio at roughly $25 million, a person familiar with the matter said.
Resolution Games is Google Venture’s first investment outside of the UK, since it established a presence in Europe, Avid Larizadeh Duggan, a general partner at Google Ventures told The Wall Street Journal.
The venture arm has invested in U.S.-based VR companies such as Jaunt or Altspace VR, but Resolution Games is their first European investment in VR.
Founded by Tommy Palm, a former executive at King Digital Entertainment Ltd., Resolution Games has released its first virtual-reality title, a solitaire game, and is working on its next release, a fishing-themed game due in early 2016.
Virtual-reality games, in which players are immersed into a digital universe with special headsets and software, have been slow to take off because of technical hiccups and some hesitation on the part of both equipment makers and game developers over the potential market.
“The risk is that VR doesn’t become mainstream,” Palm said in an interview. “But given my background in casual games, we’re well positioned for that segment,” he added.
Resolution Games’ titles are developed to work with Samsung Electronics Co.’s headset, the Gear VR, into which users can slip their smartphones and which is expected to hit shelves in the coming quarters.
“You won’t wear these things on the bus, but you might wear them at home to relax,” Mr. Palm said.
Joe Kraus, general partner at Google Ventures, was enthusiastic about the future of virtual reality.
“The pace of development in VR will be very high over the next five years, with mobile VR at the forefront because anyone with a smartphone has the core of a VR experience already in their pockets.”
Other backers in Resolution Games’ first financing round included Creandum, Initial Capital, Bonnier Growth Media, and Partech Ventures, the company said.
Amir Mizroch contributed to this report.
